chapters.title: Definition
chapters.text: Communism is an economic system advocating a classless system in which goods are owned communally and private property does not exist.

chapters.title: Ideology
chapters.text: Communism divides society into two classes: the proletariat (the working class), who make up the majority of the population within society who must work to survive while the bourgeoisie (the capitalist class), a small minority who derives profit from employing the working class through private ownership of the means of production.

chapters.title: Production
chapters.text: Production of necessary goods and services are shared and an individual’s contribution is based on their abilities and what they receive based solely on their needs.

chapters.title: Communist Manifesto
chapters.text: Karl Marx and Friedrich Engels penned “The Communist Manifesto” in 1848.

chapters.title: Example
chapters.text: Soviet Union which collapsed in 1991 and China that has amended its economic system with some elements of capitalism were notable examples of communism.
